unnormalised: The Delhi govt. announced an extension to its flagship higher education scheme on 20/07/2024. The scheme, initially launched in 2018, provides financial assistance to students from economically weaker sections pursuing higher education. Under the scheme, eligible students receive up to Rs. 50,000 per annum to cover tuition fees and other academic expenses.
normalised: The Delhi government announced an extension to its flagship higher education scheme on twentieth july two thousand and twenty four. The scheme, initially launched in two thousand and eighteen, provides financial assistance to students from economically weaker sections pursuing higher education. Under the scheme, eligible students receive up to rupee fifty thousand per annum to cover tuition fees and other academic expenses.

unnormalised: According to a press release, over 25,000 students have benefitted from the scheme since its inception. Many students pursuing degrees from DU (Delhi University) and IP University have availed it. The govt. has allocated a budget of Rs. 150 crore for the scheme in the current fiscal year.
normalised: According to a press release, over twenty five thousand students have benefitted from the scheme since its inception. Many students pursuing degrees from D-U (Delhi University) and I-P University have availed it. The government has allocated a budget of rupee one hundred and fifty crore for the scheme in the current fiscal year.

unnormalised: "This extension will ensure that more students get the opportunity to pursue their dreams," said Education Minister Manish Sisodia at a press conference held at 11:00 AM. He emphasized the govt's commitment to providing quality education to all, regardless of their socio-economic background. Applications for the next academic year will open on 01/08/2024 on the Delhi govt's education portal. Beneficiaries need to have scored a minimum of 60% in their class 12 exams.
normalised: "This extension will ensure that more students get the opportunity to pursue their dreams," said Education Minister Manish Sisodia at a press conference held at eleven A-M. He emphasized the government's commitment to providing quality education to all, regardless of their socio-economic background. Applications for the next academic year will open on first august two thousand and twenty four on the Delhi government's education portal. Beneficiaries need to have scored a minimum of sixty percent in their class twelve exams.
